ARB101.name: Elementary Arabic I
ARB101.description: Basic standard Arabic, speaking, listening comprehension, reading and writing, with emphasis on developing oral proficiency skills.

ARB102.name: Elementary Arabic II
ARB102.description: Further work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading and writing of standard Arabic, with continued emphasis on developing oral proficiency skills.

ARB201.name: Second-Year Arabic I
ARB201.description: Intermediate-level work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading and writing of standard Arabic, with increased emphasis on reading and culture.

ARB202.name: Second-Year Arabic II
ARB202.description: Further intermediate-level work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading and writing standard Arabic, with increased emphasis on reading and culture.

ARB290.name: Independent Study
ARB290.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ARB290.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.

ARB301.name: Third-Year Arabic I
ARB301.description: Third-year work on speaking, listening, reading, and writing standard Arabic. Reading, writing, and oral fluency.

ARB302.name: Third-Year Arabic II
ARB302.description: Further third-year work on speaking, listening, reading, and writing standard Arabic. Reading, writing, and oral fluency.

ARB360.name: Arabic Language and Society
ARB360.description: Historical, social, linguistic and cultural developments in the Arabic-speaking world as revealed in textual material in Arabic, including literature, essays, and film. Taught in Arabic and English.
ARB360.prerequisite: (ARB 202) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ARB401.name: Fourth-Year Arabic I (W)
ARB401.description: Advanced-level work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading, and writing of standard Arabic. Advanced-level reading and culture.
ARB401.prerequisite: (ARB 302 or approval of department) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ARB402.name: Fourth-Year Arabic II (W)
ARB402.description: Advanced-level work on speaking, listening comprehension, reading, and writing of standard Arabic with emphasis on advanced-level reading and culture.
ARB402.prerequisite: (ARB 401 or approval of department) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ARB460.name: Special Topics in Arabic Culture (W)
ARB460.description: Special topics in Arabic culture determined each semester by Arabic teaching faculty.
ARB460.prerequisite: (ARB 202 or approval of department) and Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

ARB461.name: Introduction to Arabic Literature (W)
ARB461.description: Readings of various literary genres selected from modern and pre-modern Arabic literature including different themes such as regional, diaspora, and travel literature; literature in translation. These literary works will be read and discussed in Arabic and English.
ARB461.prerequisite: (ARB 202 or approval of department) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

ARB490.name: Independent Study
ARB490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ARB490.description: Special projects arranged by an individual student and a faculty member in areas supplementing regular course offerings.
ARB490.restrictions: Not open to sophomores or freshmen. Approval of department.

ARB491.name: Special Topics in Arabic Studies
ARB491.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
ARB491.description: Special topics supplementing regular course offerings proposed by faculty on a group study basis.
ARB491.restrictions: Not open to freshmen. Approval of department.

ARB499.name: Senior Thesis Research
ARB499.description: Research and preparation of individual research projects within the student’s academic discipline, written and presented in Arabic, under the supervision of a faculty member.
